alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 2:26AM EDT until July 28 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following county, in Southeast Indiana, Franklin IN. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Batesville, Brookville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Metamora, Cedar Grove, Peppertown, Saint Peter, Mounds State Recreation Area, Hamburg, Buena Vista and New Trenton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
